topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Managing Your Cloud with the HCG Dashboard

body.p: The HCG Dashboard UI is a cloud management tool that allows users to define, deploy, manage, and monitor a HP Helion OpenStack cloud. The tool helps you provide and validate the cloud definitions required to deploy your cloud and guide you through the deployment.
Click the List of Clouds link to open the List of Cloud Definitions table where you can see a list of cloud definition and the current status of any cloud associated with the definition.
You can also use the List of Cloud Definitions table to open the Input for Cloud table to edit the cloud definition or open the Deploy Cloud table to deploy that cloud definition.
After a cloud is deployed, you can use the Manage Cloud wizard in the HCG Dashboard to reset services including:

ul.li: Centralized Logging services (Beaver, Logstash, ElasticSearch, Kibana, Icinga)

body.p:
To restart services:
Launch the HCG Dashboard.
Click List of Clouds in the Cloud panel. The List of Cloud Definitions table opens.
For the cloud you want to work with, click Manage. The Manage services table opens.
Restart the services as needed:
Restart all services. Click the Restart All button.
Restart a service on all controllers. For the service you want to restart, click the restart button in the Action column.
Restart a service on one controller. Click the Node list to select the controller. Then, click the restart button in the Action column.
